titleStmt.title: The pedegree and descent of His Excellency, General George Monck. Setting forth how he is descended from King Edvvard the Third, by a branch and slip of the white rose, the House of York. And likewise, his extraction from Richard King of the Romans. With the state, title and descents of the houses of York and Lancaster in their several branches.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for W. Godbid, over against the Blew Anchor in Little Britain,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: W. Godbid, over against the Blew Anchor
